website_summaries.verdict: Innovative swiveling umbrella protects skin at all angles.
pros: Clamp latches onto golf bags, strollers, and beach chairs
cons: Clamp could unscrew easily and fall off

customer_reviews.title: Hardware tightens securely and moves easily between equipment
customer_reviews.text: Take note of the umbrella shape.. It's not round and will cover the legs while sitting in a wheelchair. Hardware tightens securely and moves easily between equipment. Spines of umbrella are strong but fold conveniently into the included bag.
customer_reviews.author: sheila

customer_reviews.title: Wheelchair Users this is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet for Wheelchairs!!! Very happy! Clamps to all size tubes & Bends all kinds of ways, works great!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Kloser

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, it is worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Thus is the second Cancun trip with this item. It is great! My wife likes no sun so this allows us to pull a beach chairs together and I can set it up and "boom" no sun for her. The clamp holds up in wind and the adjustable angles that the umbrella has allows you to sort of aim the shade. Great product and it fits into a suitcase!!
customer_reviews.author: Quarrelman

customer_reviews.title: useless in a slight breeze
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to try this umbrella on the New Jersey shore, but no matter how tightly I connected it to my Rio high-boy chair, it wouldn't stay still, the slightest breeze made it shift and fall. Might work ok if there was zero wind but for a beach it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Swimangel72

customer_reviews.title: Broke during first use
customer_reviews.text: As far as coverage goes, it does offer more shade than the regular Sunbrella. Mine broke at the top joint only 2 hours into use and I've been waiting over a week to hear back from customer service. So, I give it one star for durability and lack of customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Leann Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Ginger Babies!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to cover our sons stroller and it works awesome for that! We made the super glue fix to the locking nut just in case and the handle grips well to any round or square tubing. Not only does it work well for the stroller, it worked perfectly in our boat over Father's Day weekend. We clamped it to the windshield of the boat and never had any issues as we traveled around the lake at speeds of 20 mph or less on a windy day! Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Winter

customer_reviews.title: Useless!
customer_reviews.text: The clamp does not work at all. It seems that the mechanism is stripped. When turning it to tighten the clamp over the chair frame, it just turns and turns, never catching. This is useless, unless you want to hold it, in which case you should buy a $3.00 regular umbrella Instead of this. I bought this as a gift for a friend and she just had the opportunity to use it on her long-awaited beach trip. It is no longer eligible for return or exchange so I am out my money and she is out her gift. Great idea but poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Merry

customer_reviews.title: They have become useless very fast!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 of these Sport-Brellas. First used all of them this summer... All have failed after 3-4 uses. They stopped holding position; The Swivels / hinges stopped locking into position, the two push button hinges also do not function / extremely hard to push in or they are stuck in the down position. I have tried lubrication all the hinges but they still do not function. They have become useless very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph P.

customer_reviews.title: Worthless with any wind...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these advance of a trip to the beach. Didn't hold up well at all in the wind and kept moving around. Unfortunately just had to remove and store...now apparently it's too late to return after 30 days......that's what you get for planning ahead......what happened to 90 day returns Amazon Prime?
customer_reviews.author: Seth H.

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: So far, this umbrella has been a lifesaver. It attached to the camp chair easily, provided plenty of shade, and stood up to a light breeze. It was noticeably cooler under the umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: J G

customer_reviews.title: Improved nut retention, very functional.
customer_reviews.text: Just received today. After reading the previous reviews, I was prepared to glue the adjusting nut into the larger handle it sits in but I didn't have to. The design of the larger handle has been improved so it now captures the small nut and won't let it fall out. After reading the directions, I was able to turn the direction of the umbrella itself inside the "stationary collar". If you didn't read the instructions, you may be tempted to try and twist the "stationary collar" to reduce the resistance to spinning the umbrella. The instructions specifically say not to do this. Very adjustable, light, functional!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Y.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Sport-Brella thinking I could attach it to my tripod so that I could cut down on sun glare that hits my LCD. The attaching clamp just fits on the tripod and the umbrella is easy to adjust but, the bar of the umbrella is not long enough to allow you to lift it above the camera. It might work better if the clamping mechanism was on an adjustable L bracket and the telescoping portion of the umbrella bar was longer. Returning item.
customer_reviews.author: EricD

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fantastic, versatile umbrella. I am the owner of a Joovy Caboose stroller (please look at photo below). The stroller did come with its own canopy, but it gave a bare minimum of shade for both my children. So I got this umbrella, and boy, was it worth it. It gave a much much more coverage for my children. The shape of this umbrella works so well for strollers, as opposed to the round circular umbrella we had purchased last year. With the round umbrella, we had to buy TWO to cover each child since the diameter was so small. But this umbrella works beautifully. Don't hesitate to buy it. It's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Pop Chips

customer_reviews.title: Great dog shade
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dog who needed some shade for his chaise. He loves it. Lays under it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good things!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for our wagon. I use our wagon far more than a stroller and found that I needed something for sun blocking. This umbrella is awesome!!! It's shape is great for the wagon and the fact that is has so many points of bending and rotating it is so easy to keep my wagon riders shaded. I got the small size and it's perfect! People stop me everywhere I go asking about my set up and I tell everyone about this umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay put in a light wind..
customer_reviews.text: These would probably be okay for someone watching a sporting event where there is no wind. We took them to the beach to put them to a test. There was a very light sea breeze. The umbrellas kept getting caught in the wind and would not stay in place. We are not happy with their performance at all. Now we are trying to figure out a way to add a strap to stabilize them when attached to our beach chair. We are thinking we will have to attach the umbrella lower on the chair and strap them towards the top of the chair to keep them from moving around. Not the performance we were hoping for...
customer_reviews.author: Shops-A-Lot

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a month... don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing was great... but it broke in less than a month with intermittent use. I use it on my patio to read... and honestly, was gentle with it. I opened it up to use it and the clip that holds all the umbrella sticks (beams?) together broke apart. Came to realize it is clipped together with some crappy hangar wire type thing. If company is willing to respond to this, maybe I got a dud? Will update if I hear anything back... but probably not worth buying this thing.
customer_reviews.author: ryan Leehey

customer_reviews.title: Great for Plein Air artists!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for plien air painting. I can use it to shade either my easel or myself. It truly clamps on to any shape stand. You unscrew it and it opens, and screw it closed to shut. To adjust, you just push in the button, swivel how you want it, and release the button There is nothing to assemble, read or figure out. It's lightweight and I can stick it into my rolling studio. It is smaller, lighter and easier that the art umbrella that I was using before.
customer_reviews.author: CJP

customer_reviews.title: Not for moving
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this umbrella because it was UVB protected and looked amazing but it did not work for the purpose I purchased it for which was an umbrella for my tricycle any amount of movement would make the umbrella fly backwards and not stay up properly it definitely would work better for sitting and non moving but definitely not for moving.
customer_reviews.author: MorLuv5

customer_reviews.title: Not that great after all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May of 19. At first it seemed it would do the trick. But after about an hour or so of use it started to slide from its clamped position. It’s also difficult to maneuver into the exact spot you want to the protection. The sun moves so you have to move this, duh versa. It has points where you can unlock to move but they just aren’t quit fluid enough to do the job needed. I tried it again at the beach today and I had to just hold it. I even had a gentlemen say “well, that umbrella is not very good”. No sir, it sure isn’t. :(
customer_reviews.author: Kristen B

customer_reviews.title: Total POC
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of these umbrellas to attach to our camping chairs. We ordered one blue and one gray. What we got was one blue and one black and white geometric design. These umbrellas are of very poor quality (cheap junk). They are not easy to adjust and some of the buttons are stiff. We felt that it would take little effort to break them while trying to adjust them. They are so flimsy and would not withstand the slightest breeze. Where are these rave reviews coming from? I would not waste the money...returning them.
customer_reviews.author: dosxx

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea. Cheap plastic connector.
customer_reviews.text: This "was" a real neat umbrella. The XL size provides more coverage than the smaller version. Had owned and used the smaller version for years and loved it. Only complaint with smaller version was the amount of shade coverage. The XL version was great for a couple of uses, then the cheap plastic connector/pivot in the middle broke, irretrievably broke. Will have to lose that middle connector, saw the two aluminum pieces and reconnect somehow to be able to use, with less functionality. No reason that a stronger connector/middle pivot could not have been used. Ultimately, this is maybe not worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Renrut50

customer_reviews.title: Broken After 2 Uses (Company DID NOT respond to questions about a replacement/refund)
customer_reviews.text: The plastic used in several spots is incredibly weak. On one particular critical hinge point it was so weak it just fell apart, rendering the Sport-Brella useless. I contacted the company (Sport-Brella) with the order information inquiring about a possible replacement or refund but they ignored my message. So, I'm here to warn you! The Sport-Brella is a neat idea but built very cheaply. The company "Sport-Brella" doesn't back their product and has poor customer service, so if something goes wrong don't expect them to make it right.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Balcony Sun Blocker
customer_reviews.text: I consider this one of the best purchases that I've ever made!! I have a tiny balcony that the sun blesses every cloudless afternoon. I'm in Texas! I need shade! I sit on my balcony on every nice, not-to-hot day but ONLY because I have this umbrella clamped to the rail, opened up, & angled just right. The multiple options for angling it just right is amazing!! I have considered buying another when the weather gets even hotter just to block the sun period! I also bought one for my daughter to put on my grandchild's wagon & they love it as well! Super light & easy put up & take down! I completely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Renee' McCain

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic umbrella! Not so much..
customer_reviews.text: I love this umbrella! Easy to maneuver. I've kept it out doors 24/7 this past month, in Sun, rain, and still as good as new. UPDATE: I stored the umbrella, as I was going away on vacation. Once I got back, I opened the umbrella and the middle button doesn't work. I can't keep the umbrella up. It's useless. I tried to contact the site it states to go to and it doesn't exist. I tried calling the company, you can't get anyone on the phone, so I left my name and number. I will update the review, on how the company responds.
customer_reviews.author: lizzyB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Its light and compact to carry anywhere. I got it to take out on the boat, I like lay in the back while my husband fishes. When you want to hide from the shade for just a bit but there's no trees around, this comes in very handy! The knob that you use to fasten the umbrella on it something does have a minor issue where it could fall off if you unscrew it too far. To prevent this, I just put duct tape over it so if it falls, it's contained to that area. No biggie for me.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Clamp looks broke after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: The clamp looks super cheap and I am not sure whether it would last at all. I used it today for the first time and a part fell from it and I don't know where it needs to go. The mold of the plastic material is so unevenly cut that it looks like a dollar store clamp. The shade itself looks quality. However, it is on the heavier side. I bought it to use with my stroller but it wasn't that easy to set up and maintain shade when you move around.
customer_reviews.author: Elena D

customer_reviews.title: PITA to set up & adjust.
customer_reviews.text: Good luck attaching this umbrella to anything but a pole or flat board. Won’t tighten on a chair arm at all. Then there are the buttons. They are very difficult to press & then the position detente don’t work. If you are lucky & get this thing attached to a chair, wrestling with the adjustments is sure to loosen the hold. This product looks to be of good materials, but I’m through messing with it. I’ll be searching for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. S.

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Our first one actually came broken but was replaced immediately, so good service response. We need it to cover a family member who is wheelchair bound in one of the larger chairs. It doesn't go all the way to her feet but does cover substantially more than a regular umbrella due to the elongated design. The top also tilts to help with coverage as the sun moves. Attachment clamp is substantially larger than anything found in a store. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Not great and attracts wasps
customer_reviews.text: I bought the XL version on sale through Amazon warehouse, and wasn't unhappy with it for the first week or 2. The clamp that affixes the item to your chair is a bit shallow, leaving it very unstable. More than once the whole thing just toppled over onto the ground. Adjusting the umbrella's position is just as likely to pop it off the chair. Won't be a problem after a couple of weeks, however, as the buttons that adjust the position stop working, altogether (all but one, anyway.) Wasps were big on trying to nest under this thing, and with a severe allergy, I just couldn't have that. I'm going back to moving my chair to the shade.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Gramlich

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella! Definitely worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with my purchase. We frequently stay at hotels with ocean front porches/patio & I was looking for some thing easy to travel with and compact. This fit beautifully on the back of the hotel patio furniture chair even Though it was an odd shape. It has great ability to adjust and clamp/lock into place. I was even more impressed with how well it withstood the particularly High winds that day. I was sure it wouldn’t stay up & would collapse but it proved me wrong & Stayed securely in place. Provided great shade and sun protection. I’ll be buying a second one after testing my first purchase- A really great product. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste the money
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, weak wired, and unstrudy. We We’re only able to use this umbrella For less than a couple of hours. This thing broke at the top of the umbrella and all the wires holding it in snapped off. When we went to go correct it, the wire broke. On top of all this, the base grip that hold the umbrella on to the chair (tho we used it to cover a table to it was never touched or moved after placement) is useless and only slightly tightens around poles. We had to rig it in order to grip our table post because it wouldn’t tighten and close all the way. This product is more of a headache than it’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Camille Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I knew I was going to be outside all summer with my kids, but my yard doesn't offer much shade by lunch time, which makes it hard to give my baby a bottle without the sun beating down on her face. This umbrella was worth every penny to be able to sit outside and feed my baby a bottle while watching my toddler play. I had a little trouble at first trying to figure out all the adjustments and angles and whatnot to keep the sun out, but once I figured it out, it has been a god send!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda McCuen

customer_reviews.title: Love it, had to buy another one
customer_reviews.text: I love these umbrellas for our apartment balcony. I love that you can easily adjust them the different ways throughout the day. I actually bought another one after receiving this one. I bought the larger one and like that one just as much. We also take them to the beach and use them on our chairs and hammock. The only downside is that the clamp doesn't stay very well and it doesn't really hold in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: tristinedenise

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product description
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon description says "the Regular size canopy spans 40 x 42 inches but that's incorrect. The actual size is 38 x 39 inches. The height is also misleading. Description states 36" high when closed, but the usable height underneath the umbrella is only 31" for the regular model when clamped to a surface at seat level. Got two of these thinking I could attach them to the base of bleachers for my youth soccer team members (6-7 years old) to sit under, and they'll work for now, but otherwise they are too short to sit under for teens and adults unless clamped on a chair arm or something at least a foot higher than seat level.
customer_reviews.author: bluttmer

customer_reviews.title: Small clamp, not well balanced - not great for arms of chairs
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in product. When I opened to clamp to attach to the arm of my Adirondak, it came apart and a screw fell off--it wasn't meant to open that wide. When I put it together and was able to force it to fit, the umbrella weight made it leans towards the heaviest direction, so it didn't stand straight up. The quality of the umbrella is fine and would probably work well if clamped to stroller or golf cart like most people do, but not ideal for my needs--personal shade for my Adirondak chair.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Goodroad

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this umbrella!! Like for real it definitely doesn’t clip easily like they claim it does. It’s a big pain in the butt to get it to clip and stay in place! I was really excited to receive it and use it on my daughters little car we bought her. But it didn’t fit..which was okay cuz we were going to use it for her stroller as well but it wouldn’t even clip on there. The opening to clip it to something is super small, it’s probably 1 inch. So definitely not worth it. And the shade is really small too. It doesn’t shade much sun
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Top part might slouch over, but keeps grip on chair and good sun coverage.
customer_reviews.text: The storage bag came torn right where the hanging loop is (I forgot to write the seller on time to see if I could get a replacement bag). Unfortunate since I would have liked to store it on a hanging rack. Great sun coverage, and ability to adjust throughout the day as the sunlight moves. The top part kept slouching down several times while I was in the pool though. I'd go tighten and would find it fallen again. After a few times I let it be and figured I'd only tighten when sitting under it. Just used once, and hope that doesn't happen a lot next time.
customer_reviews.author: PCF

customer_reviews.title: Ok. Not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: If you are someone with a MAC brand/style wagon, and say, put your kids in it despite the warning label on said wagon, this umbrella will clamp on to the back of your wagon without any issue. It will not, however, cover the whole wagon. If you have two kids, they will not be covered unless they pile into the back side and arrange themselves into a pretzel. Tilting it forward does not particularly increase coverage. Umbrella may loosen up on bouncy rides and end up falling over backwards while remaining attached to the wagon and drag behind. Seems to be fairly well made, aside from above issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G

customer_reviews.title: Ok sun umbrella with crap mounting bracket.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this umbrella for my inflatable fishing pontoon boat to get away from the god awful heat this year. It lasted for three hours (1~5 mph wind, 98*F) on the transom (5/8" tubing), until the mounting bracket failed and the umbrella quickly found the bottom of the lake before I could grab it. The mounting clamp should really be mad from aluminium not soft plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not practical and not really portable. Meh.
customer_reviews.text: For an umbrella that's allegedly designed to be used anywhere, the design is poorly thought out. The pole is not retractable, and it's nearly 3 ft long!! I really wanted to love this umbrella, but I don't. I was excited because I thought I'd have a nice umbrella I could mount to my walker and travel with, but it doesn't fit in a carry-on and the over-sized, non-retractable pole means it's not compact either. I'd need to unclamp the umbrella every time I travel and I don't want to carry a 30-inch pole in a bag. Will be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carol G

customer_reviews.title: Rotation angels are a great feature
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a small and that maybe the issue in adequate sun protection and the odd shape. The umbrella has push knobs so you could angle and move in various positions, really like that. Only protected my face and left the rest of my body exposed to the sun. I ordered a XL, I'll see how that works out. Will fit any chair type. Has a carry cover, really light.
customer_reviews.author: Luvume

customer_reviews.title: A Wonderful Sun Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: With two tilt positions you can be protected from the sun anytime it peeks it head over the horizon. I wish it were just a bit larger but for the price, you can't have everything. The clamp holds my deck rail perfectly however, be sure and coat the small spring inside with WD-40 or silicone to keep it from rusting. That is one thing they might have made from stainless steel or coated it with pliable plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Save the burn, buy the best "sun screen" out there!
customer_reviews.text: I think I'm an unpaid salesperson for these everytime I sit outdoors! They clamp easily and sturdy to my folding chair. Keep sun completely out and the triangular shape doesn't block view or cause you to bang your head when you stand up. I love the flexible settings on the pole. The quality storage bag is a plus! They're lightweight so they don't tip your chair if you have to get up. Yet strong so that wind doesn't knock them around. I rave about them everywhere I go. And so many friends ask me where to get them that I've put a masking tape sticker on the pole that says "Get this on Amazon!". Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: T. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Too short and clamp is not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this umbrella. However, it is a complete failure for me. As others have said, the clamp is really made for tubular applications. It is not sturdy on flat ones. I tried it on three flat surfaces of different thicknesses before giving up. I thought the height was adjustable but it is not. It was far to short to even allow me to get under it much less see anything but the umbrella. The angles do adjust but the adjustments are not always stable especially the one at the clamp. I sent it back. Thankfully, Amazon issued a refund. .
customer_reviews.author: Quothraven

customer_reviews.title: Nice Personal Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Have only used the umbrella for 2 days. Size (regular) is great for one person. Seems to be very adjustable, so I can position it for optimal sun-protection. It does seem a bit flimsy - moves around a bit in even a light breeze. If you open (unscrew) the clamp all the way (per their instructions), the screw and spring actually fall off. My opinion is that if the quality, and corresponding price, were increased, this would be a spectacular product, because the overall design and functionality of the umbrella are already wonderful as is.
customer_reviews.author: Tuggy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on my balcony
customer_reviews.text: My balcony gets strong late afternoon sun and this is the perfect foil. I clipped it on an extra mop handle stuck into a large plant container Gives my shade loving plants the protection they need. I only fold it down for stormy weather so it has been outside 24/7 for over a month and it seems to be holding up well without fading or getting ratty looking. It is easy to quickly fold up if I have to run out in the rain when a storm is starting. I cannot speak to its behavior as durable rain protection on a windy day as that is not how I'm using it.
customer_reviews.author: zoombamom

customer_reviews.title: Can bend twist and turn a lot of places. I used it to give me shade in a zero gravity chair!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I purchased the big one! Great idea love all the way you can use it. Pros Can twist and turn it literally any way and at multiple points Can attach it to any pole or handle bar Cons Even at the normal low setting before you extend it up it's pretty high and sometimes falls over even when it's really tightened Wish there was another way to secure it to a bar/handle as when I get up from the chair the umbrella falls over sometime Overall, I recommend if!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewExpert15

customer_reviews.title: Too lightweight!!!  Can’t hold up against wind
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product! Literally used it for the first time and the second it got a little windy it would bend. The anchor that holds it to the chair also bends the umbrella to tilt it. I set it to the right tilt but as soon as it got just a little windy the plastic piece couldn’t support it and it clicked all the way down to the ground. I wanted to be able to bring this to the beach but if it can’t even withstand wind at a soccer game it definitely won’t hold up against ocean breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not quick to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our small foot print balcony, but difficult to maneuver the joints quickly/easily with the sun. Takes elbow grease to push the buttons in, and a geometry brain. Wish there was a 360 ball joint/pivot on the head so you can quickly tilt the canopy whichever way you need, and a swivel point closer to the bottom so I don’t have to stand up every time I want to rotate the canopy. Would also benefit from a quick release clamp for quick movement to a new post of the same size and fast disassembly. Otherwise love the design of the asymmetrical canopy. The material significantly shades and reduces temperature once you get the positioning right!
customer_reviews.author: Amamazon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Perfect protection.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a skin saver for me at my local parks. I drag this and a folding chair with me when I take my kids to the park. In my neighborhood many of the parks don’t have any tall trees. (Newer development). While they run and sweat I’m cool and protected. Not to mention I can set up anywhere to see my kids instead of having to take up a bench slot out of the way. Easy to set up and break down.
customer_reviews.author: tamingchaos

customer_reviews.title: Protect my baby from the sun
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase EVER!! Used this on my stroller. Reduced heat and direct sun on my child. Very good invention. THANK YOU VERSA-BRELLA!! A Very Happy Mom :)
customer_reviews.author: sillysara7997

customer_reviews.title: Clamp is a POS
customer_reviews.text: When first attempting to mount this, make sure not to loosen it to the point that the knob used to tighten/loosen the clamp comes off. Mine has come off, along with a hex nut, and I cannot figure out a way to re-attach it. I am now using pliers to tighten the clamp. As I intended to mount this permanently, it was not a big deal not to be able to re-adjust it. However, the clamp is a total POS. As others have said, it does not get tight enough and keeps failing. I am not happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Animal_Liberation_NOW

customer_reviews.title: Hard to learn to adjust
customer_reviews.text: This is lightweight and makes good shade. I had a terrible time trying to follow the directions to adjust it. Figure it out in your house before you need to use it outside. Depending on time of day I can' get shade all over my body. Yesterday my legs got really hot in the sun (98 degrees) but face and shoulders OK. 5:15 PM daylight time. Still better than carrying a big golf umbrella and having to hold it while watching the game. I might get better at adjusting. There are lots of ways to move the umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: RKam2128

customer_reviews.title: Paid more than I should have.
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty sturdy and well made. It takes a while to adjust to the perfect spot since there are multiple joints, so you might be standing in the sun for a few mins trying to get it perfect. Also I'm really disappointed that I bought this for $29 and the next day its $19... I would exchange for the better price but the new one wouldn't be here in time for my vacation. I would be way more impressed with the quality for $19.
customer_reviews.author: PMR

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until the crucial bolt got stripped
customer_reviews.text: I loved this umbrella for about 3 months, using it probably once a week. However, the clamp mechanism relies crucially on a single bolt with thin threads, and the middle section of those threads got worn down to the point that the nut could unlock from the threads, sliding freely up and down the bolt. That destroyed the ability of the umbrella to clamp to anything, making it almost worthless. This could have been avoided with a more heavy duty nut and bolt. (I did not use the umbrella in strong winds or any other very unusual situation.) Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jess R.

customer_reviews.title: Find something else
customer_reviews.text: Can’t get it to stay on a tilted fixed position on beach chair with low winds. The fabric is good but the locking mechanism are not. They simply do not hold up when sun moves about throughout the day and you need to make adjustments to it. If your going to sit in a place where the sun is right over you and it won’t move then this is the product for you and you may also not live on earth. If you’re going to be outside for prolonged hours and will be moving or tilting the umbrella then find something else. This works best it’s going to be set on the straight up position with zero wind.
customer_reviews.author: Old School Kid

customer_reviews.title: Great at blocking shade, not a low profile umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Used this at soccer games this weekend, they worked great! The silver UV coating on the underside really does a great job of blocking the sun and the heat of the sun. It swivels and angels in any direction needed, which is great for afternoon sun that isn't directly overhead. My Mom was thinking about getting one for concerts, and I suggested she look at the regular size vs the xl, and the xl is very tall. We will for sure bring this camping as well. I'm so happy with this purchase, as it can be attached to any chair that I purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crista

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, bad customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I received my umbrella and on my second use it broke. The clamp tightens by a plastics handle, when I was tightening it down on my sons stroller it broke. They use a metal internal screw to tighten down on plastic and the screws stripped right through the plastic. I called their customer support and sent pictures and they said they would ship out a new one but it’s been weeks now and still haven’t received it. I emailed them the other day about this and they said they would look into it, still waiting for my umbrella or even a follow up email regarding my replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for wagon
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hoping it would fit on our collapsible wagon so we wouldnt have to buy a new wagon with a top or a stroller and I was not disappointed. It very easily clamped onto the square tubing on my wagon & feels very secure. I love the fact that there are three points where I can rotate the pole so that I can get the best angle to shade my baby. I also like the fact that the umbrella was not round and is able to cover more of the wagon. When clamped on the end where the pull handle is located it did not impede my ability to see or pull the wagon (i’m 5’1).
customer_reviews.author: Shenna B.

customer_reviews.title: Blessing!
customer_reviews.text: We use it in our stroller, it helps me and my toddler from getting burned and we can have a nice walk in a sunny day😊I though it was expensive but I bought it because I haven’t seen something like this before or cheaper. Well, 3 year using it, in hot summer Holliday’s.. and still worthy! This stroller in the picture is for two kids. It not catches always the son from the front one.. I’ll probable buy one more of this. I got the large one. I’ll probable get the small one to put somehow in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Ladie Apple

customer_reviews.title: Great concept; disappointing results
customer_reviews.text: I wish I liked this more than I do. The concept is great. I bought it to attach to my son's wagon and it sometimes works for that if I can get the adjustments at just the right combination. Other times, the grip comes loose and the joints start to swivel when I didn't want them to and the umbrella ends up on top of my son's head. I tried it this weekend on a beach chair and the result was even worse. No matter how tight I secured it at the base, the grip kept coming loose and the umbrella ended up drooping.
customer_reviews.author: rmc2012

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Adjustment points
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is pretty great for our double stroller since the stroller canopy doesn’t fully provide shade. It’s very easy to fold and show away in my trunk and opens up quick. It has multiple ways to adjust it on 3 points which is great depending where the sun is. What’s also great is that it can be placed anywhere there’s thick enough edge and once you tighten it, it stays put. The last time I took it to the park I had to put it away because it was a bit windy and it kept putting resistance when I would push the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: BUZ_TUED

customer_reviews.title: The bomb. Folds, shades, water resistant, and UV sunblocking powers!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these umbrellas. I bought three for three kayaks. It comes with a shoulder case for easy transport and fold. It DOES come apart by removing one twisting thing in the middle section...I was able to take it apart and fit all 3 in a carry on in the airplane! So yes! You can take it apart at the pole section and put it back together easily. My only pointer is that if you have a double kayak, this will not work well because of the size of the umbrella beside each other BUT if you have a single, it's absolutely perfect! You can angle it at any direction!
customer_reviews.author: Vada Domo

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the clamp was completely disappointing. Right out of the box when I tested it out the clamp was extremely loose, even when tightly clamped to an object, there's tons of play within the clamp, way too much, and on the first day of use it completely broke from 5-10 mph winds. I really wouldn't mind paying extra for a solidly built clamp.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy and fully articulating product.
customer_reviews.text: It's rated at SPF 50 and I believe it's very accurate. It's well made, sturdy and highly adjustable. The grip that secures the device to your chair or lounger is sturdy and effective. Strong gusts will definitely require readjusting but that's to be expected. I wouldn't hesitate to repurchase this product. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: David Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Universal clamp too heavy
customer_reviews.text: The large Versa-Brella did not work well with our kayak (a Heritage tandem). Firstly...the universal clamp, combined with the long length, is not a great combination. When securely mounting on the side of kayak rim, the bulky clamp added too much weight, bending the kayak sides in hot sun. We also tried mounting it to our pvc kayak flag pole. Even with velcro straps it wobbled, I could not reach buttons. On a positive, I give the company props for a unique umbrella design, but nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great for shade only, needs manufacturer adjustment to meet advertised description
customer_reviews.text: I loved that it blocked shade, but it didn't fit bleacher at all. The adjustment was too small by nearly 2 inches, so I had to hold the whole 6hrs, the end that's suppose to tightened onto bleacher is rather heavy and the actually umbrella rod is too short, holding it above me is literally ontop of my head, rod needs to be adjustable to go longer. Cons: Rod needs to be longer- Adjustment to fit onto bleacher needs to be widened more to open wider to place on to bleacher. This particular umbrella would only for onto chair but again, rod is too short so it'll be sitting on head
customer_reviews.author: KryptoniteX5

customer_reviews.title: Fits anywhere
customer_reviews.text: We are in an area where we have a shared pool. With pandemic they no longer provide chairs or umbrellas. So we have to carry in and carry out. My dil put this on her gift list. She was very pleased. It is very well made and a pretty color. She noticed you can put on an ice bucker or chair. It fit all she was thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good, but grip slips
customer_reviews.text: I use this frequently, and it does the job. I probably wish I got the XL version, but this version has good enough coverage. My one issue is how much I have to tighten the clamp for it to not slide around. It doesn’t have a fantastic grip. Otherwise it is nice for days I don’t feel like taking our entire beach tent.
customer_reviews.author: gdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to adjust
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella would work well if you needed to position it at a specific angle and leave it at that angle. But if you want to be able to move it around easily throughout the day, it is just incredibly difficult to use. You have to press down buttons on two different hinges and figure out which one goes the right way to accomplish the movement you want. I took it on vacation to the beach and regretted it. I prefer an umbrella with a totally flexible arm that you can just bend whichever way you want.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Must have for summer!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this about three years ago and my husband used it and liked it so much recently with all the "Covid driveway happy hours" he bought an additional one for him. It is easy to maneuver and angle to block the sun, but non-intrusive. It is easy to fold and replace in the carrying case. It is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Sara B.

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite baby products ever!! I use it on the jogging stroller to walk in the rain, over my side by side double stroller, to make shade at the beach, to give my napping baby a bit of darkness in the stroller, etc. It's held up really well this summer and folds narrow so I keep it in my very small trunk space behind my third row. I have little spatial skills so it takes me like 5 minutes of adjustment to actually be at the correct angle but once it's on I haven't had any issues with it coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Jilly

customer_reviews.title: Shade is great, clamp may not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the beach. It's a crap shoot as to whether the clamp is going to fit securely (or at all) on a particular outdoor/beach chair. But if it does fit, and unless there's a breeze, it provides effective protection from the sun. I especially like the shape and how it can be rotated to block rays coming from different angles during the day. However, It gets only 3 stars because the clamp components are plastic and there is more "play" in its grip than I like -- plus, I don't see how plastic threading can hold up under repeated use without stripping or distorting.
customer_reviews.author: judy s.

customer_reviews.title: Great agility in a sun shade
customer_reviews.text: We have hooked this up on a work truck as sun shade for hot days. It secures to everything, even the edge of a hose reel and the top edge of the truck door. With the number of ways it can angle and twist, I'm excited. Right out the box a technician asked if he could use it with his backpack. I'm sure we could figure out a way to do it with this agile shade. Nice corner coverage to keep metal from poking out. I hope it lasts as long as it looks like it should. The material feels great. Just bought 12 more for the rest of the fleet.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella for the sun
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to put on camp chairs at a beach. I loved the way they can be adjusted as the sun moved during the day and the oval shape really worked to keep me in the shade. t was easy to open and attached to the folding chairs really well. It is very lightweight and easy to sling over your shoulder while you are carrying the chair, towels, etc to the beach or where ever you are going. It does only shade one person, but it worked great for what I bought it for and I can see using it in the future to watch grandkids play sports, or going to a parade.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect umbrella for the beach chairs !!! So easy to fold and carry !!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these umbrellas to give us shade at the beach and use them for our beach chairs.My son can easily carry both of them and also his sister's beach chair every time we go to the beach. And i am so happy i can carry one if these umbrellas to give me shade at my son's football games.I just attach it to a metal part of the tribune and don't need to carry huge tents with us etc.Benches have no sun shade.By trainings i will take a beach chair and an umbrella.Top !!! Great purchase !!!
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Maier

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Swivel
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to attach to our chairs during lacrosse tournaments. They do a great job blocking the sun, but we almost returned them because it took a number of uses before we figured out how to get the top of the umbrella to swivel—it’s very hard to do. We read in an answer above that the umbrella has to be clamped to something to swivel and that did the trick. It would be great if that was included in the instructions! Everything else functions as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Anitra

customer_reviews.title: Baseball Moms! Get one!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to keep my little one cool and shady at baseball for my bigger little one. This is perfect. Whether I want it on the stroller, my chair, or even the fence, it works. Love the 3 different pivot points as well as the 360 degree spin! Paired it with a battery powered clip on fan and we're super comfy even in extreme summer heat!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great for bleacher seats
customer_reviews.text: We have the big Sport-Brella and I live in it at baseball tournaments, however there are times when i just want a quick fix to the sun. I brought this to a track meet and attached it to my bleacher seat. HEAVEN! It was a little breezy out and not once did I fear it falling over or blowing away. If I sit on the top of the bleachers, I’m not obstructing anyone’s view and I get the best shade in the house. One lady in front of me even asked if she could scoot over so it would shade us both. (Which it did). Love this, I will be buying some for my other sport moms as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Cali B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small chair and area.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had purchased her own to sit on the rooftop of her New York building to do laptop work on Zoom. I was so impressed with her set up, I bought this for myself. She told me to get the larger umbrella ,but we have a small patio. We have a translucent cover over the patio that acts like a magnifying glass in the late afternoon. I was able to easily clip the umbrella onto a chair and I can now read on the patio in the heated afternoon which I could not before. I love this!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Great but one production flaw
customer_reviews.text: The people who designed this were cheap. While it's a great product they chose to include a flimsy piece of plastic that is supposed to hold the bolt in the clamp. Now I need to make a separate trip to the hardware store to rectify this. A proper washer would have cost maybe 25c at most. Proper production and thought of your customers is a lost art these days. The rods that hold the umbrella up are also a bit flimsy, and could have been thought out a bit better, seriously guys who designed this....Did you cut corners on purpose?
customer_reviews.author: Francis K.

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly ..
customer_reviews.text: We use these for the beach under the umbrella. Sometimes when two people are under an umbrella and the sun is low on the horizon. The rays just get under the umbrella and hit a shoulder or arm. We put these up and poof no sun .. We also take them to the waters edge where we can't have an umbrella .. keeps most of the body out of the sun if adjusted and chair placed correctly depending on angle of sun in the sky. Already on our 2nd year .. look the same as we bought them ..
customer_reviews.author: CrazedMonkey

customer_reviews.title: I really like the versatility of this product
customer_reviews.text: I really like the versatility of this product. It will be perfect for how active we are outside and on the boat! Only flaw, and this was through first and the replacement..... The extension part, extended our or not, the umbrella will spin down. The clamp does not provide enough pressure on the arm to keep it in place. Incredibly annoying. I will have no choice but to put a thin screw through it to keep it from rotating. I recommend using a better method for the arm extension. Other then that it seems like a decent build for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for the beach
customer_reviews.text: Decided I needed an umbrella this year for the beach but carrying a full size wasn't going to work. Found the personal umbrellas on Amazon and read the reviews and checked how you attached them etc. This umbrella lis excellent. I have been careful not to over tighten or force it into positions without loosening first. It really can go in any direction you need. Very light weight but held up great. Only issue is in a strong wind it will shift but that is to be expected. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: The clamp on the umbrella works great on the chair for which I ordered it but the umbrella provides very poor coverage for the chair! No matter how I position the umbrella only half of the chair is shaded. Very disappointed with this product. It doesn't provide half the shade my $5 umbrella from Academy Sports provides. Would not recommend this umbrella; the extra large might work better but I wouldn't order it at the price and then have to pay return shipping if it wasn't any more satisfactory than the large I ordered. Really disappointed to be stuck with this $20 umbrella or have to pay return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Cookbook Fan

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for kids
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product except that it's only like 2' tall, so unless you have a high-back beach chair, your head may end up hitting it, and if the sun is in front of you, forget it, it's too short to attach to the back of the chair, and if you attach it to the front it will be right at eye level. If the shaft was twice as long, this would be a great product. As-is, it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: J. Studebaker

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot of coverage but the attachment arm and holder quality are excellent
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you get the extra large, the smaller version is tiny and only good for a single small beach chair. Even the extra large is not very big and it has a triangular shape. The best part about this attachable umbrella is the attachment arm which is very flexible and stays in place I'm just about anything and especially works well if you attach it to something movable. Also something other people don't mention because of the shape it does well in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Milo Tindle

customer_reviews.title: Great for covering a baby stroller
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it is a very nice umbrella. It is easy to open/close, easy to clamp on to any item, and easy to adjust. The only complaint I would have is it seemed like I always want a couple more ways to adjust it. At least with the way our stroller is set up, I feel like to get it in angled anything close to parallel to the ground, or angled forward at all, the umbrella is at a 45 degree angle off to the side. Even if there was a way to rotate the umbrella at the middle adjustment elbow, I feel like it would be a lot easier to align it.
customer_reviews.author: Cymru129

customer_reviews.title: They're as versatile as described.
customer_reviews.text: These have worked out so well. We've been able to attach them to a few different things (table, chairs, even rolling walker with seat on it). The only issue of concern, will be over time, how fast the plastic clamps will degrade. The clamp is plastic, the screw is metal. Plastic ages and wears down with use. Time will tell. Even if we only get 2-3 summers of use of them, they're worth the price, and we'd order them again if available, when that time comes.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: When I go to the beach with my wife I spend most of the time in the water and she spends it on the sand but does not like the sun. We found this umbrella more convenient to bring than a large beach umbrella which is heavier, has to be put in the sand, and can be affected by wind more readily. The umbrella attaches fairly easily to a beach chair and provides adequate protection from the sun. Good to have if one wants individual protection from the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Albert D.

customer_reviews.title: Not for Grayco Baby Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Be forewarned that this will NOT work with the Grayco 3-in-1 Baby Stroller, the horizontal shape of the handle will not hold the clamp. Also, it is quite a bit bulky for a baby tool, and stiff bar does not allow all possibilities. I had a totally bendable cheap umbrella for my kids years ago, looking for the same for my grandson, this is not it. Maybe it is good for other uses, I do not know. Also bolt will fall out if fully opening clamp, ouch, it could get lost easily,
customer_reviews.author: Ulrich G. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy in the wind
customer_reviews.text: I have used this umbrella now two separate times at the beach and it held up well. One of the times, the weather was very windy. It held up well and did not blow out or fall down. I even had someone come over and ask where I got it because it held up so well. I like the versatility of the adjustments and I could move it as the sun moved. It held on well to my chair. However, I also put my towel over the base to keep it in place even better. My husband is ready to purchase another one for his chair!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good quality; axes of movement are somewhat difficult to manage
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to provide shade to a rolling cart. The item is exactly as described. It's a little difficult to predict how to move the three adjustment points to put the shade where you want it, because each adjustment point moves in different directions, on a different axis. I wish there was a locking ball joint instead. The adjustment points lock where you put them though, so if you get the shade where you want, it'll definitely stay.
customer_reviews.author: ArtDeco

customer_reviews.title: Clamp is junk
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time I went to use it. I was trying to open the clamp for a larger pole, and a piece fell off and fell in between the cracks of my deck. It's completely unusable without whatever fell off. Lots of reviews complain about the same situation. I can't believe that they haven't fixed this issue. Also, there is no way to reach the seller. What a pain. I'm gonna return. It’s a great umbrella if I had all the pieces or could reach customer service for parts.
customer_reviews.author: GOC

customer_reviews.title: It'll Probably Be Fine
customer_reviews.text: The material is fairly thin, and then I went and made the mistake of pulling off the white consumer tags instead of cutting them, so now there's a hole. I guess I'll consider sewing it if I ever think I'll actually be sitting outside while it's sprinkling. I really bought it more for sun shade, and I think it will do a decent job. I got the regular size and it isn't overbearing, but probably won't cover all of me if I'm in full sun. It is a little clunky when it comes to adjusting the angles, but overall, it will probably be just fine!
customer_reviews.author: NiaAwakening

customer_reviews.title: Made in the shade!
customer_reviews.text: Took this to beach vacation in Florida and I was the envy of everyone! It worked great allowing me more time at the beach with some shade. The wind did not effect it and I had no issues with it! Only thing is that it doesn’t fit my suitcase so had to send it down with a friend who drove. That would be my only recommendation.to allow it break down to fit in suitcase. My friends are getting these shades for next year and people who were walking the beach and stopped to see where I got this fantastic product!!!
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I'm pale. So being in the sun ALL day is never a good choice if I can help it. I got this gem b/c I needed SOME kind of coverage. I am SO happy I have this umbrella b/c I get TOTAL shade. I have your basic Academy brand fold up outdoor chair and this umbrella tightens perfectly to the arms of my chair and really, any chair. When the sun moves, you can adjust the shade just right without the umbrella falling. It combats wind well and it's been one of the best purchases I've made bc of it's versatility and ease of use. I can't wait to use this again for our vacation to the beach this year!
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great looking umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: This little umbrella really looks great. I use it on our balcony outside our condo. I attach it to the railing and it is easy to move back and forth and up and down. It took some getting use to, but once you get the hang of it, you can get it to cover almost any angle of the sun. But, be careful! It is a lightweight umbrella, so do not abuse it our force it in anyway. Be gentle and it will last you a long time with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Bannister

customer_reviews.title: Great little umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It stays in the van with me at all times. The universal clip is awesome and clips on to anything. So I can always provide shade for my littles no matter what they are in... bike...wagon...stroller...sitting in a lawn chair. It's amazing! And I have talked 2 neighbors into getting one too. I also love how it can bend in so many different directions. So you can block the sun no matter where the umbrella clips. Very clever design!
customer_reviews.author: SuzBaxter

product_meta.title: Sport-Brella Versa-Brella SPF 50+ Adjustable Umbrella with Universal Clamp
product_meta.description: There’s no reason to search for shade when you can bring it with you. The Sport-brella Versa-Brella offers protection from the sun for any outdoor adventure. Whether watching your favorite player run down the field or spending a day at the beach, the Versa-brella offers quick set-up sun protection. The UPF 50+ protection blocks 99.5% of UVA and UVB light to help keep skin safe. With a compact carrying case and a weight of less than 2 pounds, the Versa-brella offers hassle free set-up and easy transportation. When open, the Regular size canopy spans 40 x 42 inches and the XL size measures 44 x 44 inches. When folded down, both the Regular and the XL measure just 3.5 inches wide and 36 inches long. The connector clamp attaches to both square and tubular surfaces and it has two push-button hinges for easy adjustment to allow for perfect angles to block the sun. Use the Versa-Brella for all your favorite sports adventures. Includes 1-year limited manufacturer’s warranty.
feature_bullets: UPF 50+ protection. The Versa-brella is a clamp-on shade canopy umbrella that offers UPF 50+ protection to help keep skin safe from 99.5% of UVA and UVB rays

Rugged cover and durable connector: The rugged canopy cover won’t rip or tear; A heavy-duty universal clamp connects to square and tubular surfaces and ensures a secure hold on golf bags, strollers, beach chairs, or even bleachers
Adjusts to any angle: The 4-way, 360-degree swivel and 2 push button hinges allows the Versa-brella to be adjusted to any angle to block the sun

Easy transport for easy protection. The Versa-Brella conveniently folds into a compact carrying case, weighing only 1.8 pounds, so it can be taken anywhere. When opened, the regular size spans 38 x 39 inches

Have no fear. From the beach to the sidelines, the Versa-Brella lets you stay committed to your team, family, and friends, while keeping your skin protected against the sun; 1-year limited manufacturer's warranty
